text.p: True or False: If [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] has an inner product, and [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is a finite-dimensional subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]v\in V[/mathjaxinline], then there is a vector [mathjaxinline]w\in W[/mathjaxinline] which is closer to [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] than any other vector in [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is.

font.p: True! We can find an orthogonal basis of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] (e.g., via Gram-Schmidt) and take the orthogonal projection of [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] onto [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]. We have proven that the projection is closer to [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] than any other vector in [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline].
